titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ مَاتَ وَ لَيْسَ لَهُ إِمَامٌ مِنْ أَئِمَّةِ الْهُدَى وَ هُوَ مِنَ الْبَابِ الْأَوَّلِ
titles.en: Chapter 87 – The one who dies and there isn’t an Imam<sup>asws</sup> for him from the Imams<sup>asws</sup> of Guidance – and it is from the first chapter (above)

titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ مَاتَ وَ لَيْسَ لَهُ إِمَامٌ مِنْ أَئِمَّةِ الْهُدَى وَ هُوَ مِنَ الْبَابِ الْأَوَّلِ
titles.en: Chapter 87 – The one who dies and there isn’t an Imam<sup>asws</sup> for him from the Imams<sup>asws</sup> of Guidance – and it is from the first chapter (above)

text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ عَائِذٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أُذَيْنَةَ عَنِ الْفُضَيْلِ بْنِ يَسَارٍ قَالَ ابْتَدَأَنَا أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَوْماً وَ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) مَنْ مَاتَ وَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ إِمَامٌ فَمِيتَتُهُ مِيتَةُ جَاهِلِيَّةٍ فَقُلْتُ قَالَ ذَلِكَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) فَقَالَ إِي وَ اللَّهِ قَدْ قَالَ قُلْتُ فَكُلُّ مَنْ مَاتَ وَ لَيْسَ لَهُ إِمَامٌ فَمِيتَتُهُ مِيتَةُ جَاهِلِيَّةٍ قَالَ نَعَمْ .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moalla Bin Muhammad, from Al Hassan Bin Ali Al Washa, from Ahmad Bin A’iz, from Ibn Azina, from Al Fuzayl Bin Yasar who said,

‘One day Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> initiated us saying: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The one who dies and there isn’t an Imam<sup>asws</sup> over him, so his death would be a death of the ignorance (Pre-Islamic era)’. So I said, ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said that?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes, by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, he<sup>saww</sup> has said that?’ I said, ‘So everyone who dies and there isn’t an Imam<sup>asws</sup> for him, so his death would be the death of the ignorance (Pre-Islamic period)?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes’.

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (219/ 4)
text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْوَشَّاءِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِي عَبْدُ الْكَرِيمِ بْنُ عَمْرٍو عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي يَعْفُورٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنْ قَوْلِ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) مَنْ مَاتَ وَ لَيْسَ لَهُ إِمَامٌ فَمِيتَتُهُ مِيتَةُ جَاهِلِيَّةٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ مِيتَةُ كُفْرٍ قَالَ مِيتَةُ ضَلَالٍ قُلْتُ فَمَنْ مَاتَ الْيَوْمَ وَ لَيْسَ لَهُ إِمَامٌ فَمِيتَتُهُ مِيتَةُ جَاهِلِيَّةٍ فَقَالَ نَعَمْ .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moalla Bin Muhammad, from Al Washha who said, ‘Abdul Kareem Bin Amro narrated to me, from Ibn Abu Yafour who said,

‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about the Words of Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>: ‘The one who dies and there isn’t an Imam<sup>asws</sup> for him, so his death would be a death of the ignorance (Pre-Islamic period)’, I said, ‘A death of disbelief?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Death of straying’. I said, ‘So the one who dies today, and there isn’t an Imam<sup>asws</sup> for him, so his death would be a death of the ignorance (Pre-Islamic period)’.
en.sarwar: 1. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from Mu‘alla ibn Muhammad from al-Hassan ibn Ali al-Washsha’ from Ahmad ibn ‘Aidh from ibn ’Udhayna from al-al-Fudayl ibn Yasar who has said the following. “ One day abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) initiated to speak to us and said, ‘The Messenger of Allah has said, “Whoever would die and is not under the (guardianship) of the Imam his death would be like a death in ignorance.” The narrator has said that I asked, “Is that what the Messenger of Allah has said?” The Imam (a.s.) said, “Yes, by Allah, he has said so.” I then said, “Do all who die without acknowledging the Imam die as if died in ignorance (without religion)?” The Imam (a.s.) said, “Yes, that is right.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (220/ 4)
text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنِ الْفُضَيْلِ عَنِ الْحَارِثِ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) مَنْ مَاتَ لَا يَعْرِفُ إِمَامَهُ مَاتَ مِيتَةً جَاهِلِيَّةً قَالَ نَعَمْ قُلْتُ جَاهِلِيَّةً جَهْلَاءَ أَوْ جَاهِلِيَّةً لَا يَعْرِفُ إِمَامَهُ قَالَ جَاهِلِيَّةَ كُفْرٍ وَ نِفَاقٍ وَ ضَلَالٍ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Idrees, from Muhammad bin Abdul Jabbar, from Safwan, from Al Fuzayl, from Al Haris Bin Al Mugheira who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The one who dies without recognising his Imam<sup>asws</sup>, dies a death of the ignorance (Pre-Islamic period)’?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes’. I said, ‘Ignorance of not knowing (being uneducated) or ignorance of not recognising his Imam<sup>asws</sup>?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Ignorance of disbelief, and hypocrisy, and straying’.
en.sarwar: 2. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from Mu‘alla ibn Muhammad from al-Washsha’ who has said that ‘Abd al-Karim ibn ‘Amr narrated to me from ibn abu Ya‘fur who has said the following. “I asked abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) about the words the Messenger of Allah. ““Whoever would die and is not under the (guardianship) of the Imam his death would be like a death in ignorance.” The narrator has said I then asked, “Is it death in disbelief (in religion)?” He said, “It is death in error .” I then said, “Thus, whoever would die today and would not have an Imam would his death be considered as if he has died in ignorance (without religion)?” He said, “Yes, that is true.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (220/ 4)
text: بَعْضُ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ عَبْدِ الْعَظِيمِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ الْحَسَنِيِّ عَنْ مَالِكِ بْنِ عَامِرٍ عَنِ الْمُفَضَّلِ بْنِ زَائِدَةَ عَنِ الْمُفَضَّلِ بْنِ عُمَرَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) مَنْ دَانَ اللَّهَ بِغَيْرِ سَمَاعٍ عَنْ صَادِقٍ أَلْزَمَهُ اللَّهُ الْبَتَّةَ إِلَى الْعَنَاءِ وَ مَنِ ادَّعَى سَمَاعاً مِنْ غَيْرِ الْبَابِ الَّذِي فَتَحَهُ اللَّهُ فَهُوَ مُشْرِكٌ وَ ذَلِكَ الْبَابُ الْمَأْمُونُ عَلَى سِرِّ اللَّهِ الْمَكْنُونِ .

en.hubeali: Some of our companions, from Abdul Azeem Bin Abdullah Al Hasany, from Malik Bin Aamir, from Al Mufazzal Bin Zaida, from Al Mufazzal Bin Umar who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The one who makes it a Religion without listening from a Truthful one (Imam<sup>asws</sup>), Allah<sup>azwj</sup> would Necessitate the hardship to him; and the one who claims to have heard from a door other than which Allah<sup>azwj</sup> has Opened, so he is a Mushrik (who associates with Allah<sup>azwj</sup>), and that (the Truthful Imam<sup>asws</sup>) is the door of security upon the concealed secrets of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ahmad ibn Idris has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbar from Safwan from al-Fudayl from al-Harith ibn al-Mughira who has said the following. “I said to abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) , ‘the Messenger of Allah has said, “Whoever would die without knowing who his Imam is he would die as if has died in ignorance (of religion).” The Imam (a.s.) said, “That is true.” I then said, “Is it the ignorance of uneducated people or ignorance of ones not knowing his Imam?” The Imam (a.s.) said, “It means the ignorance that is disbelief, hypocrisy and error?”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مختلف فيه ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (4/221)
text: 4ـ بَعْضُ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ عَبْدِ الْعَظِيمِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الله الْحَسَنِيِّ عَنْ مَالِكِ بْنِ عَامِرٍ عَنِ الْمُفَضَّلِ بْنِ زَائِدَةَ عَنِ الْمُفَضَّلِ بْنِ عُمَرَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ السَّلام) مَنْ دَانَ الله بِغَيْرِ سَمَاعٍ عَنْ صَادِقٍ أَلْزَمَهُ الله الْبَتَّةَ إِلَى الْعَنَاءِ وَمَنِ ادَّعَى سَمَاعاً مِنْ غَيْرِ الْبَابِ الَّذِي فَتَحَهُ الله فَهُوَ مُشْرِكٌ وَذَلِكَ الْبَابُ الْمَأْمُونُ عَلَى سِرِّ الله الْمَكْنُونِ.

en.sarwar: 4. Certain persons of our people have narrated from ‘Abd al-‘Azim ibn ‘Abdallah al-Hassani from Malik ibn ‘Amir from al-Mufaddal ibn Za’id from al-Mufaddal ibn ‘Umar who has said the following. “Abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) has said, ‘Whoever would follow the religion of Allah without hearing (instructions) from a truthful (Imam) person Allah will cause him, inevitably, to suffer hardships. Whoever would claim to have heard from a source other than the one Allah has opened for him, he will be considered as polytheist. The source and door that Allah has opened is the one that trustworthy in the matters of the hidden secrets of Allah.”
